node.title: NT quarantine rules easing despite COVID-19 outbreak
node.alt: Michael Gunner removes a face mask while standing at a lectern in Parliament House.
node.description: The NT Chief Minister is ushering in a suite of changes to the Northern Territory's border rules but admits some willÂ say it is "too dangerous or too reckless". Here's what you need to know.
node.content:
["This weekend marked a milestone for the Northern Territory.", "A month-long pilot program trialling two-week home quarantine for fully vaccinated travellers ended.", "According to the Chief Minister, it was a success.", "So much so, the government announced over the weekend the Territory is moving into the next phase.", "Under sweeping changes to the border rules, starting today, fully vaccinated arrivals will only have to quarantine at home for seven days.", "And if all goes well over the next month, quarantine for fully vaccinated arrivals could be abolished altogether on December 20, just in time for Christmas.", "\"There will be some special interest groups that say this is too dangerous or too reckless,\" Chief Minister Michael Gunner said at a press conference on Saturday.", "It may seem like odd timing to ease restrictions as the Northern Territory races to stifle its worst COVID-19 outbreak to date.", "But the Chief Minister says he is confident he can keep the Territory safe \"while also getting the Territory open\".", "
So\u00a0how will it work?
", "From today, there will be two major changes to the Northern Territory's border rules.", "First, unvaccinated arrivals will be turned around at airports and fined, under one of Australia's strictest border policies.", "Only NT residents, children under 12, people arriving for compassionate reasons and a small number of essential personnel will be able to apply for an exemption to get in unvaccinated.", "They'll be required to test and isolate on arrival.", "The second big change is\u00a0fully vaccinated arrivals from a red zone will only have to quarantine for seven days if they are staying in a \"high vaccination zone\".", "For now, this rules out Katherine and many remote communities until they reach the golden 80 per cent vaccination rate.", "The government says you will need to return a negative PCR within 72 hours of coming to the Territory, take a rapid antigen test at the airport \u2014 or the first regional centre if arriving by road \u2014 get tested on day five, eight and 14 and stay in the high vaccination zone for a further week.", "And, just like the pilot program, your quarantine won't impact household members if everyone is fully vaccinated. Testing for these people has been dropped altogether.", "The Chief Minister says the government is now confident the testing and tracing regime is solid enough to \"isolate any household contacts extremely quickly in the event of a positive case\".", "
What is a red zone?
", "In September the NT government announced its roadmap to reopening that included a traffic light system for travel.", "The Northern Territory's Deputy Chief Health Officer, Charles Pain, on Saturday said a region would be declared a red zone if there was evidence of community transmission of the virus on a \"widespread scale\".", "So, if it's a hotspot, it will be classified as a red zone.", "\"Green zones are where we have comfort that there is a low risk of transmission,\" Dr Pain said.", "
Is this a good idea amid an outbreak?
", "The Chief Minister thinks so.", "It mainly comes down to something called rapid antigen testing and the safeguard ushered in by locking the unvaccinated out.", "Mr Gunner says the ability to now rapidly test people when they arrive\u00a0at airports is a \"game changer\" that \"makes a big difference to the risk matrix\".", "\"It gives us an extra layer of protection\u00a0and gives us the confidence to start moving away from home quarantine.\"", "According to Mr Gunner, until now, mass testing of arrivals was not a viable option because rapid antigen tests \u2014\u00a0much faster with a 15-minute turnaround, but less accurate than the \"gold standard\" PCR tests \u2014\u00a0were not available at scale.", "", "
A COVID-19 rapid response team has been deployed to the locked-down community of Rockhole.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "But from tomorrow, all NT airports will have the capacity for rapid testing, and all arrivals will be required to take a test.", "Rapid antigen tests were contentiously phased out for staff working at Howard Springs earlier in the year, and they were replaced with PCR saliva-only tests.\u00a0", "Questioned on this at the press conference, Mr Gunner provided assurances PCR tests would remain in play as the Territory's number one measure and would\u00a0be used if you returned a positive result to a rapid antigen test.", "The Territory won't be the only jurisdiction to take this leap.", "From December 17, when the state is due to reach its 80 per cent vaccination target, Queensland will open its border to interstate travellers \u2014 but only if they are fully vaccinated.", "
What will happen to those who haven't rolled up their sleeve?
", "", "
Rapid antigen testing capabilities\u00a0will be ramped up at NT airports, including the Darwin Airport.\u00a0(Supplied:\u00a0Darwin International Airport)
", "The new rules usher in a suite of restrictions for Territorians who are yet to be vaccinated, and even put fines on the table.", "Unvaccinated NT residents won't be locked out of the Territory, but they'll have to undergo 14 days of supervised quarantine at their own expense to get back in, ruling out home quarantine.", "Unvaccinated arrivals to an airport or a road border will be fined and turned around.", "Mr Gunner said the latest COVID-19 outbreak was a reminder that the risk was too great.", "\"This has all happened because someone who wasn't fully vaccinated came here with COVID,\" he said.", "\"If you are not a returning Territory resident and you are eligible to be vaccinated and you are not fully vaccinated, then you don't get to come to the Territory.\"", "
Is quarantine-free Christmas travel on the cards?
", "Hopefully, yes.", "If the next four weeks go well, Territorians will be able to fly home for festive family reunions with the knowledge they can easily return after the holidays,\u00a0abolishing quarantine a month ahead of the plan.", "Mr Gunner says that over the next month the government will make sure the system works, while also increasing testing capabilities at airports.", "From December 20, every single person who enters the Territory will take\u00a0a rapid antigen test on arrival.", "\"Because of that, we will no longer require fully vaccinated arrivals from red zones to quarantine,\" Mr Gunner said.", "
'Christmas is coming early' for bars, cafes and tourism operators
", "", "
Hospitality NT chief executive Alex Bruce says the changes are positive.(ABC News: Isabel Moussalli)
", "Hospitality NT chief executive Alex Bruce says the relaxed border rules are \"very, very positive\".", "\"It looks like Christmas is coming early,\" he said.", "Mr Bruce says while a few questions remain over where people will be allowed to travel during the seven days after quarantine for the next month, the plan provides\u00a0more certainty for bars, restaurant owners and the tourism industry.", "\"We're looking forward to heading further down the path back to good old normal.\"", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
"]
